meanings.definition: To make known; to reveal or show.
meanings.sent1: She kithed her secret to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The detective kithed the hidden clue to the team.
meanings.sent3: The magician kithed the surprise ending of his act.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise kithed the beauty of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight kithed the singer's talent for all to see.

meanings.sent1: He kithed the hard work of his team members.
meanings.sent2: The teacher kithed the student's improvement in class.
meanings.sent3: The dog kithed the arrival of its owner with a wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The applause kithed the actor's outstanding performance.
meanings.sent5: The award kithed her dedication to the cause.

meanings.sent1: The host kithed the guests with warm smiles.
meanings.sent2: The family kithed the new member with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The sunflower kithed the bees with its bright petals.
meanings.sent4: The harbor kithed the ships returning from sea.
meanings.sent5: The cheers kithed the winning team at the championship.
